revised_title: Semi-Decussation of the Optic Nerves and Visual Impairment
tldr: The author discusses the semi-decussation of the optic nerves and its implications for vision impairment. They propose a new arrangement of the optic nerves that better explains the observed facts in humans and fish. The author also shares personal experiences with vision impairment and provides evidence for their theory through a case study of a friend.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Neuroanatomy and Ophthalmology
